message.content: Yes, the authors provide details about the experiments conducted in the paper and the Appendix E section. They describe the data generating distributions, hyperparameters, sample sizes, choice of kernels, and experiment repetitions. They also explain how they chose the scale parameters using the median heuristic and specify the computation setup they used for their experiments.

Yes, the authors provide sufficient details regarding the experiments, including data generation, parameter choices, kernels used, and an explanation of the methods being compared. These details can be found in the main text, as well as in Appendix E where additional implementation details and experimental results are reported. The authors also mention the computing infrastructure used for the experiments.

Yes, the authors provide details of the experiments, including data splits, hyperparameters, and how they were chosen. These details can be found in the main text of the paper and Appendix E, where they explain their experimental setup, data distributions, sample sizes, selection of kernels, scale parameters, and other implementation aspects. They also describe the computing infrastructure used for the experiments.
